alert.note: Alert for Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued January 16 at 6:10PM MST until January 17 at 12:00AM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Visibility below 1/4 mile in freezing fog. * WHERE...High elevations of the Sacramento mountains, especially Cloudcroft, NM. * WHEN...Until Midnight Tonight. * IMPACTS...Driving will be difficult due to the combination of low visibility and potentially slick roadways.
info.instruction: A Freezing Fog Advisory means visibilities will frequently be reduced to less than one quarter mile. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. Also, be alert for frost on bridge decks causing slippery roads.
